europeana:record.dc:title: [Proceedings of the symposium 'Molluscan Palaeontology' : 11th International Malacological Congress, Siena (Italy) 30th August - 5th September 1992 / A.W. Janssen and R. Janssen (editors)]: Jurassic gastropods from Sicily; new data to the classification of Ataphridae (Trochoidea)
Scripta Geologica. Special Issue
europeana:record.dc:creator: Szabó J.
Conti M.A.
Monari S.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Paleozoölogie
europeana:record.dc:description: Members of Ataphridae became a progressive group in one of the two types of Tethyan faunas. Some of the new forms, which evolved from ataphrid ancestors, can be classified within the family, whilst others show a transitional morphology towards the turbinid subfamily Colloniinae. Other finds suggest a close relationship between Ataphridae and Crossostomatidae.
